In the first century of the Christian era, traveling by sea as well as by land was attended with far greater difficulty than at the present 
                                                                           262
time. The arts of ship-building and navigation were not then matured as now. Mariners directed their course by the sun and stars; and when these did not appear, and there were indications of storm, they were fearful of trusting their vessels to the open sea.
